subject: Relationships
title: The 200-Hour Rule of Friendship
description: A short lesson to help you apply The 200-Hour Rule of Friendship.

hook.text: It takes about 200 hours of time together for someone to become a close friend. Acquaintances happen in 50.

buildup.text: Sociologist Jeffrey Hall found that friendship forms in predictable time stages: 50, 90, and 200 hours.

discovery.text: At 50 hours you become casual friends. At 90, real friends. At 200, close friends. Time is the ingredient.

twist.text: Adults struggle to make friends because they lack the unstructured time. School gave it naturally; adulthood doesn't.

climax.text: Friendship isn't about finding the right person. It's about investing enough time for a bond to grow.

punchline.text: Friendship takes 200 hours. There's no shortcut to closeness.

quiz.question: How many hours does it take to become close friends?
